description: Hybla Heraia (modern Ragusa) was an indigenous center of ancient Sicily that came into contact with Greek and, later, Roman and Byzantine cultures.
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: Ragusa Ibla

properties.description: Open Street Map location of the archaeological area in the hamlet of Ibla (municipality of Ragusa)

references.formattedCitation: BTCGI XIII, 343-62

names.details: Hybla Heraia is listed as "Ibla Erea" in the BTCGI. The association with Ragusa Ibla that is stated in the Barrington Atlas, is mentioned as possible in the BTCGI but the site is labelled as unidentified, while Manni 1981 explicitly rejects such association.
